Reviews.Title: The Phone to Die For
Reviews.Author: KaShiDC
Reviews.Content: As a Palm Pre Plus user I was devastated to learn that HP decided to kill Palm. As the last iteration (unless HP gets a clue that they have a competitor for the almighty iPhone)Palm Pre 3 is even better than my original Palm Pre Plus. All the quirks in the previous versions have been addressed here. It does not pause, take an extended time to turn of and off, and has the battery life it should have had all along.CONS: It's not 4G. A tad larger than the original Palms. I would never buy an iPhone due to the size, I want a small phone that fits in my hand, despite the larger size which makes it difficult to fit in some women's jeans size is still very manageable. Limited applications but I have always found everything I needed.PROS: WebOS - what else can I say? A savvy world-phone with all the bells and whistles of the original Palm. As a previous Palm user I simply had to log into my Palm profile and everything was on my new phone, contacts, apps, email. Mobile hot spot at no extra cost.Do I love this phone, yes, yes, yes. I have no hope that HP will revise this little diamond so I can only hope someone develops a comparable 4G phone before I need a new phone.

Reviews.Title: Yes!
Reviews.Author: determinedd
Reviews.Content: It works well and it's webOS! On top of that, Skype with the front-facing camera, auto-focus on the rear camera, nice speed, the WebOS Internals team and the greatest mobile phone community in the world make this a must have.

Reviews.Title: Best smartphone that never got released
Reviews.Author: Jerry C. McBride
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone long after it was suppose to be released.  It is not 4G and not as fast as some other phones.  Webos is far superior in its design it is a real shame that it has been kind of drop kicked to the curb.  It is not without its flaws but it is so far and away more intuitive than the other os's available that it is just hard to imagine why it fell through the cracks.  Oh well, maybe one day it will be picked up by someone and be revised and ran with.  For now I will just keep on trying to find the left over's of this amazing operating system.  The fact that it failed is truly an example of the fact that big money and the correct marketing wins every time.  And that people are sheep.  If you want a good intuitive easy to use and you don't want to follow the crowd then buy smartphone.

Reviews.Title: The phone the Pre should have been all along
Reviews.Author: sah "sah"
Reviews.Content: One wonders if this had been the Pre that was anticipated and introduced all along, and with proper carrier marketing and promotion, if this wouldn't be one of the top three smartphones out there now. I've owned the original Pre, the Pre Plus, and the Pre 2, and while I liked all of them, I LOVE this phone!  A bit expensive but to me, worth it. Phones are FUN again!

Reviews.Title: this is the greatest phone
Reviews.Author: rich s
Reviews.Content: Too bad HP bought out Palm. This phone is way better than any of even the newest phones.HP is a joke of a company nothing they make works and the things that do work like this phone they cant even manage.

Reviews.Title: Great phone but no support, Thanks HP
Reviews.Author: Waltimus
Reviews.Content: The hardware on this phone is great.  The operating system is THE BEST.  It feels nice, the keyboard is improved, and the resolution is good even for today's standards, but unfortunately the lack of support, thanks HP, made me leave this phone after 2 weeks.  In a world dependent on the cloud, having very few apps is a disservice even if the hardware is great.  This phone and operating system could have had such a bright future in the right hands.

Reviews.Title: The Best Way to Experience WebOS
Reviews.Author: Joshua R.
Reviews.Content: 2 years ago, I bought a Palm Pixi because it was incredibly cheap off-contract, for a smartphone. I didn't think I'd come to like WebOS as much as I did. After a brief stint with Android (which I reluctantly went to after hearing of HP's stupidity in killing WebOS), I got fed up and went looking for another off-contract WebOS device. Lo and behold, I found a Verizon-compatible Pre 3!This phone is leaps and bounds ahead of my Pixi in terms of performance, as well as having the most up-to-date WebOS. The experience is incredibly smooth, and the higher-resolution screen is wonderful. Physically, the phone is perfectly constructed, with all of its pieces fitting tightly and uniformly. The sliding mechanism is a bit stiff at first, but I'm now comfortable with it. I expect this phone to hold up for a long while, hardware-wise. The OS version, 2.2.4, leaves a lot to be desired, particularly with Google Talk and Voice. Basically, there is no Google Voice application, so I must go back to carrier voicemail. Talk has problems staying logged in when I transfer from 3G to WiFi, or when I lose signal (which is quite often in my location), and it will not pull the latest IMs from Google once it does log back in. The 'logging out' issue is apparently a bug with WebOS 2.2.x, and was never resolved. Hopefully someone in the community can create a reliable fix. Aside from that, the phone is awesome. Running concurrent programs is as easy as any desktop OS, and access to WiFi, Bluetooth, VPN (which is built into the OS), and Airplane Mode can be had from any program simply by tapping the battery/signal area. This phone (and any WebOS phone, for that matter) never forgets that it is a phone first, and a PDA/Pocket PC second.kulaj promptly emailed me a tracking link for my express shipping (which was so cheap it seemed criminal not to get) in a timely manner, and packaged the product very securely. Everything was as the description said, with all the materials being present. Activating it on Verizon was something of a pain because of Verizon, but the phone did its part well. Be aware that adding the phone via Verizon's web account will likely cause them to insist upon you switching data plans; the plan they want you to "switch" to will be identical to your current plan (even with unlimited data, if you are grandfathered in).If you like WebOS, or are sick of Android/iOS/Windows Phone, I would wholeheartedly encourage you to buy the Pre 3. Its biggest flaw is a lack of support and programs, but with WebOS being open-sourced, we will likely see more developers creating programs and porting apps from other platforms.

Reviews.Title: I love this phone
Reviews.Author: micrbbns
Reviews.Content: I had the Pre +, Pre 2 and now Pre 3. What this phone can do with my HP TouchPad is amazing. I was able to do touch to share and I could text over SMS. You can't do that with ipad and iphone. Was easy to activate with Verizon, I just call *228. God I wish HP would of been able to pull this off. Can not believe this will be my last Pre.

Reviews.Title: Best operating system.
Reviews.Author: Jerry Ray
Reviews.Content: My 4th Palm/ webos phone , very intuitive and the best planning mesh with other apps. The magnetic charger has always been ahead of the game as well. I don't really need a 1/2 million apps.

Reviews.Title: WebOS goes out with a bang
Reviews.Author: billchase
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for instant download of apps of infinite variety, then stick with iOS or Android.  However, if you are looking for a platform that just does everyday things well and efficiently then this a great choice.  With Preware installed, the phone can be tweaked and customized however you choose.  If you still have unlimited data with Verizon, then this is a great phone to utilize that - do keep in mind tethering is not "officially" supported.  If you are still on an older Pre, Pixi, or Pre2 then do yourself a favor and get this phone.  Two concerns to note: Skype works great, but having that account active takes a toll on the battery.  Wi-fi use also seems hard on the battery.  I did not have any activation issues.  Plenty of how-tos on webosnation forum.

Reviews.Title: Great phone but...
Reviews.Author: JMichelle "Mrs. J. Joseph"
Reviews.Content: This is a well built phone.  I know the OS would be outdated before purchasing it so I didn't expect too much as far as apps and programs go. However, I did install Preware, which did help out a lot. With that being said, the phone's performance is great. I use it mostly for work and am able to get everything done with it. Texting is great, picture quality is great and the card interface keeps everything in order for me. The only draw back, in my opinion is emailing, as I am not able to attach and send large files.

Reviews.Title: pre 3 phone
Reviews.Author: tsdesigns1
Reviews.Content: this is a great phone. why in the world hp stoped it , is beyond me. it dones more then the i phone. and withe hp touch pad and the pre 3 together wow what you can do. i pad or phone together can not do what theses 2 can do togetheer or a part.

Reviews.Title: Best phone ever!
Reviews.Author: Spike
Reviews.Content: At first I was afraid I wouldn't be able to activate the phone. But, once I did this is the Webos phone that should have always been and never was! Best phone ever!

Reviews.Title: Dropped calls and smelled weird
Reviews.Author: awry
Reviews.Content: I returned this phone within a week or so of purchasing it. It dropped calls all the time (even with full service). It's not very intuitive to use, but it was cheap so I decided to check it out.  It failed at doing the most basic thing a phone should do: make calls.  It also had this weird urine-ish smell.You're better off with a flip phone.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY IT DOES NOT WORK
Reviews.Author: Consuelo
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because after 2 months of using it. Out of no where I turned it off because it would just take me to voicecalling. so when i turned the piece of s*** off. it showed to connect to computer, so i did, nothing happen. i had to wait till the battery went down and i charged it and it worked, but it would constantly take me to voicemail. so i just bought another phone.

Reviews.Title: phone does not work
Reviews.Author: Marilyn99
Reviews.Content: I have tried working with Verizon on the phone for over an hour and reading everything I can find on the web to find tips for making this phone work. So far no luck.  I am going to a Verizon Store tomorrow and if thay can't make it work I will ship it make for a refund.
